page.title: 19Local Entertainment.
page.content: Blackwood, as the district's focal point, hosts the main entertainment. It has a cinema which opens daily. It's operatic society has two or three productions a year whilst the dramatic society has a four placed season. Both of international class, practice at Cefn Fforest and Libanus respectively. Outside this, popular enterainment is provided by working men's clubs. On the organised side is a general conformity of presentation. The weekend is invariably set aside for dancing, bingo and the "concert". This might take the form of resident artists singing or playing and a general sing-along. Occasionally a professional artist is engaged. Week days see skittles, pool and cards take place competitivley. The clubs always provide Christmas parties and Summer outings for members children.
